fileHeader.contentDescription:
Pump control example for CONTROLLINO MAXI Automation
Outputs: DO0 -> %QX0.0 -> Process running/emergency indicator DO1 -> %QX0.1 -> Pump working indicator DO2 -> %QX0.2 -> High level indicator DO3 -> %QX0.3 -> Low level indicator R0 -> %QX1.0 -> Control pump contactor coil
Inputs: AI2 -> %IX0.0 -> NO Pump contactor auxiliary contact AI3 -> %IX0.1 -> NO High level sensor contact AI4 -> %IX0.2 -> NO Low level sensor contact AI5 -> %IX0.3 -> NC Pump magnetothermic protection auxiliary contact AI6 -> %IX0.4 -> NO Start button AI7 -> %IX0.5 -> NC Stop button
Behavior: The start button starts the process, the pump will try to maintain the level between the low and high levels. The stop button stops the process. The pump turns on when the level is lower than the low level sensor and stops when it reaches the high level. The low level indicator will blink with with a period of N milliseconds in case of critical level, meaning that the level is bellow low level sensor. The emergency condition stops the process and occurs when the magnetothermic pump protection activates its auxiliary contact, or the pump feedback from pump contactor auxiliary contact is not recieved after N seconds, or also when the pump does not reach the desired level after N seconds. In an emergency condition, the emergency indicator blink with a period of N milliseconds. After the emergency condition, the start button must be pressed to reset the emergency condition and try to restart the process, also the stop button resets the emergency condition.

CONTROLLINO - First software open-source PLC (ARDUINO compatible)
https://controllino.com/ https://github.com/CONTROLLINO-PLC/OpenPLC_examples https://www.arduino.cc/
author: CONTROLLINO firmware team version: 0.1.0

content.xhtml:p:
OpenPLC HAL for CONTROLLINO MAXI Automation see https://www.controllino.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/CONTROLLINO-MAXI-Automation-Pinout.pdf
Digital In: AI2, AI3, AI4, AI5, AI6, AI7, AI8, AI9 (%IX0.0 - %IX0.7) AI10, AI11, DI0, DI1, DI2, DI3, AI2, AI3 (%IX1.0 - %IX1.7)
Digital Out: DO0, DO1, DO2, DO3, DO4, DO5, DO6, DO7 (%QX0.0 - %QX0.7) R0, R1, R2, R3, R4, R5, R6, R7 (%QX1.0 - %QX1.7) R8, R9 (%QX2.0 - %QX2.1)
Analog In: AI0, AI1, AI13, AI13 (%IW0 - %IW3)
Analog Out: AO0, AO1 (%QW0 - %QW1)

In PLC programming it is always a good idea to make a routine that clearly identifies the inputs and outputs with real life use and only in this routine outputs and inputs manipulation happens.
AI2 -> %IX0.0 -> NO Pump contactor auxiliary contact AI3 -> %IX0.1 -> NO High level sensor contact AI4 -> %IX0.2 -> NO Low level sensor contact AI5 -> %IX0.3 -> NC Pump magnetothermic protection auxiliary contact AI6 -> %IX0.4 -> NO Start button AI7 -> %IX0.5 -> NC Stop button

Behaviour:
The start button starts the process, the pump will try to maintain the level between the low and high levels.
The stop button stops the process.
The pump turns on when the level is lower than the low level sensor and stops when it reaches the high level.
The emergency condition stops the process.
Clasic start/stop implementation with also EMERGENCY stopping the process.
Start pump when level is bellow low level switch
Stop pump when level is above high level switch or process is stoped

OpenPLC HAL for CONTROLLINO MAXI Automation see https://www.controllino.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/CONTROLLINO-MAXI-Automation-Pinout.pdf
Digital In: AI2, AI3, AI4, AI5, AI6, AI7, AI8, AI9 (%IX0.0 - %IX0.7) AI10, AI11, DI0, DI1, DI2, DI3, AI2, AI3 (%IX1.0 - %IX1.7)
Digital Out: DO0, DO1, DO2, DO3, R0, DO5, DO6, DO7 (%QX0.0 - %QX0.7) R0, R1, R2, R3, R4, R5, R6, R7 (%QX1.0 - %QX1.7) R8, R9 (%QX2.0 - %QX2.1)
Analog In: AI0, AI1, AI13, AI13 (%IW0 - %IW3)
Analog Out: AO0, AO1 (%QW0 - %QW1)

In PLC programming it is always a good idea to make a routine that clearly identifies the inputs and outputs with real life use and only in this routine outputs and inputs manipulation happens.
DO0 -> %QX0.0 -> Process running/emergency indicator DO1 -> %QX0.1 -> Pump working indicator DO2 -> %QX0.2 -> High level indicator DO3 -> %QX0.3 -> Low level indicator R0 -> %QX1.0 -> Control pump contactor coil
Pulse generation for emergency indication (see T_BLINK initial value).
Pulse generation for critical level indication (see T_BLINK initial value). Meaning level is bellow low level sensor

The emergency condition occurs when:
The magnetothermic pump protection activates its auxiliary contact.
The pump feedback from pump contactor auxiliary contact is not recieved after N seconds.
The pump does not reach the desired level after N seconds.
Error in pump start feedback (see T_ERROR_PUMP_ON initial value). If there is feedback the timer will be reset and the error will not happen.
Error in reaching low level (see T_ERROR_LEVEL initial value). If the system reaches low level before the error time then the timer will be reset and the error will not happen.
Error in reaching high level(see T_ERROR_LEVEL initial value). If the system reaches high level before the error time then the timer will be reset and the error will not happen.
Any error will set the emergency condition and will be reseted on process start or on stop button press.
